Pours a clear copper golden with lacing sudsy white head. Dry fruit Belgian yeast aroma. Dry fruit and spice flavors, touch of sweet finish.

On tap at Russian River. Comes a clear reddish gold with a small tan head. Aroma of malt, spice, and fruit. Taste is malt, spice, fruit, and grass. Pretty good.
Draft at the source. Clear gold, off-white head. Aroma of light malt, grass. Taste is light malt, grass, mild fruit, spice, yeast. Decent. Very drinkable.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2017 Aroma: none; Appearance: clear, dark golden straw with white head; Taste: malty with some belgian spice; Palate: med-heavy body; Overall: better than expected for a beire de garde.

Tap at the brewpub. Pours clear amber. The odd one in the block, with a more clover-like grassiness, but also meaty and almost salty. Still not offensive in any way, feels older than other beers though, also through the palate.
half pint at the brewery. not the best beers from sonoma county. belgian style with no more.
Pours crystal clear Orange copper. Moderate carbonation and palate. Aroma of alcohol and fruit but this is not a high alcohol beer. Taste is of fruit, slight malt, slight hop bitterness.
Pours a clear amber golden with a white head. Competing tart and sweet nose. Bland clove and flat banana flavors.

Draught at Russian River. Copper color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, hops, nuts, earthy notes, ripe fruits and grass. Bitter taste with citrus, hops, earthy notes, toffee, yeast and grass. Very nice brew.
August 3, 2016 - on tap at RRBC. Clear dark golden pour with some head. Aroma and taste of malt, fruit and spice. Taste also had a splash of alcohol.
2008 Bottle. Brown pour with tan head. Sweet Belgian candi, light oxidation, yeast and Belgian tones. Yeast, fruit, Belgian candi sugars, light oxidation Flavors.
Bottle- dark brown white head- nose and taste of caramel, oxidized fruits, woody biscuit- medium body

On tap at Russian River Brewing in Santa Rosa, CA-USA. Dark orange clear, off-white foam. Nose: Belgian yeast, esters, peers. Mouth: clean start, funky in the middle, tart finish, extravagant. Did not get it. Requires more time and perhaps talks with the Brewer.

W tle leciutki cytrus (cytryna, limonka). Z drugiej strony karmel i nuty chlebowe. W smaku przypomina w niektórych aspektach Saisona. Średnio-pełne. Pikantny pieprzowy, przyprawowy finisz. Oleista faktura. Nic wyjątkowego.

Tap to glass @ Russian River Brewing tap room@ Santa Rosa,CA
A: Dark Amber clear, big white foam goes away slowly
A: Grains, yeast, oaky, woody
T: Low bitterness, low sourness balance
MF: low carbonation
OA: Very good beer for the style, ok to repeat
Drank April 14, 2016

3 finger lite tan foamy head... very pretty.. took forever to die back.. left nice lace atop a crystal clear deep amber orange brew.

Aroma is toasty malts.. with waffs of caramel.. sorta musty .. a little biscuity.. and toasted bread.

Flavor begins with a nice unexpected bitter punch to the back of the palate... melts forward into the above mentioned toasty malts.. not as much caramel as I would have expected there either.. more of a nod toward caramel... a sorta nutty essence with a little bit of dried fruit.. some spiciness that is tough to put a finger on... reminds me of a saison with quite a bit of victory malt thrown in... finish though is fairly dry.. lingering hints of the previous sip hang out for quite a while.. body is lite/medium with smooth creamy carbonation.. drinkability is dangerous.
@ Russian River 16-3-7: Tydlig malt och bröd och en lite kryddig eftersmak. Nja kanske ingen favorit.

On tap at Tustin Brewing during Russian River week. Yeasty, slightly musty aroma. Hazy, dirty amber color with a very faint head. Some barnyard funk is noticeable but not overwhelming. Nice cooked caramel sweetness balances out the tartness. Theres an earthy woodiness to this thats really nice. Finishes with a little tanginess and honey sweetness. Very tasty.
On tap at RR. Poured darker orange brown with white head. Aroma light dark malts. Light carb med bod. Taste quite malty balanced bitter roast sweet.

Draft at the brewpub. Pours deep ruby with a creamy off-white head. Grainy bread in the nose, some ripe berries. Medium sweet flavor with more grainy bread, light dough, toast, old orange, berries, meringue. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Bready sweet finish, more grains, ripe fruits. Not bad.

Glass on tap at the brewpub. Clear copper pour with thin white head. Aroma is toasty, grainy, Belgian yeast, very balanced. Taste is lightly toasty, roasty, so smooth, balanced and easy drinking. Palate is med bodied with good carbonation. Tasty.

Draft sample at the brewpub, Santa Rosa. Light amber orange coloured pour with a sticky off white head. Aroma is toasted bread, rye, grainstore, some rustic grains. Flavour is composed of slightly nutty toasted grains, light fruit esters, berry. Little Belgian rustic character. Palate is semi sweet, moderate carbonation. OK.

Draft to taster at the brewpub. Looks good; a transparent pale copper with foamy off-white head with fine bubbles in it. Smells malty with notes of biscuit alongside some nuttiness and a touch of earthiness. Tastes like it smells with a semi-sweet backbone. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied. Not bad, but unmemorable.

Tap at the brewpub. Amber-orange with a low, fine head. Nose is earthy, with caramel, cherry, a bit of chocolate, and spicy yeast. Lightly sweet, spicy flavor, with caramel and chocolatee, citrus, earthy. Solid.
On tap at the brewery. Pours a dark amber with medium frothy off white head leaving sticky lacing. The aroma is floral, yeast, bubblegum. Medium mouth, honey malt, sweet, spice, light finish, good.
Tap at russian river, santa rosa. Copper color, white head. Aroma has flowerish notes, fruits and creamy notes. Balanced sweet malty taste, fruity, balanced.

Pours a hazy golden yellow on tap with fluffy white head that dissipates to leave moderate lace. Aroma and taste of big Belgian esters and a sweet malty backbone, but still pretty light. Not bad, nothing exciting.
Tap poured clear copper with a medium white head and nice lacing. Aromas of light roasted malt, caramel, and biscuit. Flavor is mild bitter.
Light straw Amber color and thin white head. Aroma of grapefruit and very light banana. Moderate malt and grapefruit bitterness. Crisp with nice carbonated finish.

Draft to taster at RR brewpub
Grains and earth. 
Clear, light amber, thin long lasting white head. Taste is up front yeast, bubble gum, sourness, light malt.

750ml bottle thanks to Eric. Pours out a cloudy rust color topped with sand head. Nose is bread malts nutty notes and some roast. Taste is more of the nutty notes nice malt. This has held up very well for batch 2.

text: Sampler at the brewpub in Santa Rosa. Orange-copper color with small white head. Grainy, yeasty, caramel, some apples, the fruit comes through towards the end. Soft mouthfeel. Very nice and balanced, but not exactly a Biere de Garde imo...

3 oz chilled pour from tap into cylindrical taster as part of Russian Rivers everything on tap sampled (16 beers this time around) at the brewery itself. I realize that drinking 16 different 3 oz pours is not ideal for proper rating, but when will I ever have an opportunity like this again?

Great amber color, very clear. Great body. Kind of an apple or grape juice nose without the sweetness. Taste is full and refreshing.

Draught at the Russian River Brewing Co, Santa Rosa, CA.
Clear golden colour with a small white head. 
Fruity yeast, mild bitterness and sweetness in the aroma. 
Fruity hops, mild dark fruits, yeast, moderate bitterness and dryness in the flavour. Decent American Belgian Ale.
on tap at the brewery; clear amber color; dry, bitter, floral hops with caramel malt and Belgian yeast flavors
This poured a light brown with a beige head. Aroma was of dark fruit, blegian yeast and caramel. Flavor similar, lightly tart and rustic.

Deep amber/copper with a one-finger color white head and thin lace. Aromas of Belgian yeast,grassy hops, toffee, caramel and nuttiness. Flaovrs of toasted malt and caramel sweetness, slightly sour ripe fruit and nuts. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, smooth mouthfeel and a lingering tartness.
Draft at Fathers Office in Culver City. Pours a clear, dark copper color with a thin, laced head. Thick, malty aroma with a bit of spice. Dry taste with malt and spices lingering. Good brew.

Light honey color, lots of pretty lacing. Now much in the way of aroma. Sine caramel and yeasty undertones. Flavor is malty, caramel. I have not had many biere de gardes, but it reminds me of two brothers biere de garde.Which is to say its good, but not exceptional.

Copper colored... Aroma of toffee malts, biscuits... Flavor is light caramel, nutty malts, English malts... Light earthy bitterness on palate... Solid

Draft at Russian River with Linh. Pours a clear golden body with thin white lacing. Aroma is fruit and sweet malt. The nose is pretty tame overall. Mouthfeel is watery with notes of clean malt, fruit, spice, and grass. Ok.

On tap at Russian River. Pours a copper color with a white lacy head. Aroma of grassy hops, caramel and almonds. Flavor of toasted malts, caramel, banana, nuts and some sourish berries. Medium bodied, soft carbonation and smooth mouthfeel. Easy-going.
"i was hoping for more farmhouse funk here. its got a slightly spicy aroma, a yeasty mouthfeel and flavor. a good belgian session ale, light and refreshing, but basic."

On draft at the source, fuck this place gets crowded. pours murky and hazy amber brown with small to medium white head. Flavors are dark fruits mostly plum, caramel malt, Belgian yeast, wood, light copper, and nuts. Medium bodied with sweet malting in the finish.
Deep copper colour. Malty ttoffe caramel aroma and flavour. Sweet with a bittersweet finish

Draft at brewery. A light caramel and toffee in the nose. Some earthiness. Taste is sweet with some caramel. Just kind of ok I guess. Nothing exciting for me.

On tap @ Russian River. Pours a bit hazy straw yellow appearance with an off white head. Some white fruits in the nose. Banana, pear. Black pepper. Flavor is a bit twangy and herbal. Some grass. Fairly dry. I didnt really enjoy this that much but would like to give it another shot.
On tap at the source. Pours a cloudy pale color. Aroma is saisonesque with lots of clove, pepper, banana, and pear. Taste is medium sweet with some caramel maltiness that goes with the yeastys.

Draft as part of the full sampler at Russian River. Hazy golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of spices, yeast, citrus. Tastes of spices, citrus, yeast, floral notes. Medium-light body with a dry finish.

On tap at the brewery. Pours brown/amber with a lacy, off-white head. Aroma of spicy yeast, some pale and slightly darker and caramel malts, some light fruits, and a dryness. Flavor the same with a nice blend. Average texture. A pretty good beer.

Sampled at Russian River, Santa Rosa, CA. The sample pour was brought with several others. The pour is amber with an off white uneven head. The aroma is lemon citrus, bread, hops, funky floral notes, yeast, hops, grass. Flavor is same as aroma. Dry finish. From notes 2/19/13.

One of their weakest offerings, I think. Smells metallic, slightly dank, mouthfeel is bready, malty slight hop presence, mostly dry. It is overall quite one dimensional and rather plain in my opinion. Finishes with a dry, almost metallic taste I dont enjoy. Carbonation is lively. Meh.

Keg at Russian River, Santa Rosa, 27/04/14.
Hazed orange amber with a moderate light beige covering that retains well.
Nose is spice, lemon rind, straw, earthy, orange peel, hedgerow, light herbal.
Taste follows, citric rind, grassy tones, light spice, orange peel,
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a grassy linger.
Decent for style, refreshing stuff.

text:
Draught @ Russian River, Santa Rosa, CA

Pours murky orange with a smooth white head. Aroma of earthy notes, yeast, spices, hops and grass. Taste is smooth, earthy and yeasty with some grass, fruity hops and spices. Finish is yeasty and a bit stuffy with some smooth ripe fruitness. Quite untypical Biere de garde.
Pours a burnt golden color with a white head. Fruit, spice, tart, malt and some hop aroma. Fruit and spice flavors with a hoppy finish. Medium light body and average carbonation.
A bit of a let-down compared to other Russian River fare. Cloudy, with an unusual taste that I couldnt quite place.
A pretty okay biere de garde. Malty with a sharp hop bite at the end. Some dirty malt character brought it down. Tried at the brewery in 2014.
On tap @ RR. Pour is murky brown/orange with a small off-white head. Notes of vanilla, candi sugar, yeast, and citrus peel. Flavor is dull and sweet, a lot of belgian qualities.

On tap at the Brewpub in February 2014.

Hazy dark orange with a small head. Aroma and taste of light funk, citrus, yeast, malt and some earth. The finish was dry. A descent one. 


.
Sampler at the brewery- pours cloudy amber. Aroma is spices. Taste is like a wit beer with spices. Good.
From the sampler tray at the brewery. Hazy golden pour. Citrusy, earthy aroma. Good.

Draft at the brewery. Pours a slightly hazy amber light copper color with a thin off white head. Aroma is quite mild, with hints of caramel and spice. Flavor packs a bit more spice. Mild to moderate in body with a lingering spice character. Solid.
Draft - Grass and a bit of funk. Hazy gold with a rich head. Grass, light citrus and funky yeast. Nice but nothing out of the ordinary,

Tap at Russian River: cloudy, amber copper with thick light tan. Head. Malty, roastedm nutty, toffee, smokey caramel aromas. Light hops. Off dry to dry, phenolic to medium bitterness but not sour. Medium to full bodied, creamy and medium to long. Very fruity palate with roasted flavours. Not quiet traditional. Its bigger, richer and roasted. Loads of hops on the palate. Slight pine. Hints of fruit cake. 
Lovely beer. Creamy nitrogen texture on the palate

Tap. Murky dark yellow orange, nice creamy head. Banana, light sour hay, slight sweet vanilla, and nice nuttiness in the aroma. Flavor is nicely sour, some slight sweetness, touch sour, hay, earth, small sweet maltiness but nicely dry. Light soft creamy body.

On tap at Russian River, pours a murky cloudy orange with a small off-white head. Nose of Belgian yeast, some light funk, and citrus. Flavour brings out wild yeast, funk, citrus zest and almost white wine like complexity. Must be the most complex and highly drinkable biere de garde Ive had. Delicious stuff.

On tap at Russian River brewery in Santa Rosa. Pours an orange amber with a beige head and tart, sweet, fruity aroma. Taste is of fruits, caramel, malt, hops, and yeast with a fruity finish. Nice brew

On tap at the brewery, Santa Rosa, pours an amber orange color with a small head. Nose is yeasty and spicy with a predominance of cloves.Taste is yeasty as well with spice and the cloves very pronounced. Finish is dry and ends on the same tasting notes. quaff score 8 / 10
Colour is light orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, sweetness and malts.

Poured into a goblet. One finger of head on a hazy, dark straw colored body. 
The aroma is grain with ripe grapefruit.
The taste is nice: moderate bitterness with grapefruit and a sweet lemon finish. 
The texture is crisp with moderate carbonation.
A tasty drink.
Tap. Pale amber with off white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, spice and a light citrus. Flavor is sweet malt, biscuit, citrus, light spice and a slight bitter.

Color is great, but nose didn't impress much and taste was pretty one-note, some bitter and not much else.

tap- Pour is gold with a white head..Nose is nice balance of malt and hops, tropical fruits, sweetness..Taste is caramel, nice balance, tropical fruits, spice, light bitterness..nice palate.

Draught @ Russian River Brewing, Santa Rosa, CA
Pours cloudy deep golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, yeast, caramel and earthy. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long fruity and yeasty finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
On tap at brewpub on 062013. Hazy light amber with a white head. Aroma has earthy notes, grain, sweet fruits and spices. Smooth with a malty sweetness and some spicy/yeasty overnotes.

On tap at the brewpub. A hazy dark golden beer topped by an off-white head. Some dark dried fruits, roasted hints and caramel. Some fresh fruits as well. Lightly sugary flavor, still its rather dry on the palate, with caramel and notes of roasted malts. Some grass and bitterness. Full body. Not youre average biere de garde, but sure nice. 130806
On tap at the brewpub. Pours golden with with a white head. Aroma of peachy hops, malt, fruitiness and yeast. Flavor is sweet and malty with floral and peachy hops. Medium body, average carbonation.

Mild malt aroma. Light miner color. Lacey head. Spicy taste in the finish. Light body.

the beer is amber hued with a half inch + of off white head. The aroma brings bread, hops, funk, floral notes, yeast, hops, grass, lemon zest. Nice flavor, following the aroma. Nice blend of earth, hop, floral aspects. A solid beer. Russian River remains one of the best breweries in America.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2013 Growler. Poured a slightly hazy amber color with a small permanent off-white head. Aroma was light spice notes. Flavor was light spice notes, malt character. Light, but not overly refreshing.

Tap at Russian River 10.28.2012.. Pours a beautiful brown with a wispy white head that leaves a nice lacing. Smell is cloves, bananas, grain, malt, and a hint of dried fruit. A bit sour and bitter up front. Fruity sweetness in the aftertaste. Rich and creamy mouthfeel with the slightest bit of astringency on the finish. Good brew.

tap- Pour is gold with a white head..Nose is nice balance of malt and hops, tropical fruits, sweetness..Taste is caramel, nice balance, tropical fruits, spice, light bitterness..nice palate.
Pours murky amber with low white head. Aroma of yeast, hay, barnyard, light fruit. Taste is light sweet before an astringent bitter finish. Light creamy body with flat carbonation.
Had on draft at the brewery. Very fruity, spicy, tropical fruits, malty, very good, enough bitterness to balanced. Tasty beer.
Dark orange color with small white head. Aroma of hay, wheat and yeast with some floral notes. Malty taste with medium hoppiness and bitterness. Some spices. Dry finish.

goblet at Brewpub. good aroma. sweet. yeasty. bready, mild fruitiness.  tad hazed brownish orange. ok head and.lace. sweet tart. flavor. medium body, smooth creamy mouthfeel, bittersweet finish. tasty, warms up.nicely. flavor best part.

text: On tap at the brewpub. Pour is hazy orange with a frothy cream-colored head and great lacing. Fruity, tangy, light banana, clove, biscuit, coriander, pepper, and citrusy aroma. Taste is banana, biscuit, straw, fruity, biscuity, light caramel, straw, pepper, grassy, and bitter with a crisp, dry finish. Medium body with high carbonation. Tasty stuff and perfect for this hot Spring day.
Draft @ brewpub. Pours almost clear amber with a small tense beigish head. Aroma is weak to medium yeasty herbal spicy a bit phenolic. Flavor is yeasty soicy malty herbal earthy and bitter.

Tap at Russian River 10.28.2012.. Pours a beautiful brown with a wispy white head that leaves a nice lacing. Smell is of cloves, bananas, cereal grain, malt, and some dried fruit at the end. Some roasted sour and bitter flavors up front. Some stewed fruit and a slight sweetness at the end. Rich and creamy mouthfeel with the slightest bit of astringency on the finish. Very smooth, and very easy to drink.

On tap@ OBriens: Poured a dark golden honey color with a slight tint of red and no formation of head as the beer was topped off in a Trappist Chimay glassnice work Obriens for presenting the proper glassware. Aroma is moderate with a dash of spicy yeast and some heavy malts. The flavor is somewhat tart or sour but a taste of lemongrass and anise see come through to give this beer some form of life. Too funky of a beer for my taste and had a weird aftertaste of rubbing alcohol or perfume. More of a beer I didnt like and certainly left a bad impression on me.

Glass at RR. Aroma and flavor of banana esters and wild yeast. Nice hoppy aroma and flavor, but not really my style. Pretty good beer.

The grass and earth are present throughout, giving it a very natural mouth feel.  The palate is medium bodied, sweetish finish with lingering yeast.  Really nice version of the style.

Good but nothing special. Malty and flavorful. Not a big brown fan

On tap at fathers office

Amber pour at RR.  Mostly white head.  Grassy aroma up front, some spicy yeast notes and biscuity malts.  Flavor is pure and clean, quite refreshing an so damn easy to drink.

Tap at Fathers Office - Santa Monica.  Pours clear tawny with a large, frothy off-white head, short retention with light lacing.  Aroma is cookie and caramel malt, spicy and earthy hops, dates and spices.  Flavor is malt forward with medium hops and bitterness, spices and dates with a dry finish.  Medium body, warmth and carbonation.

Tap at RR Brewpub. It pours amber, with a foamy white head. The nose is hay, floral, wheat and yeast. The taste is hay, floral, caramel/golden syrup sweetness, herbal, spice, straw and dough, with a dry finish. Medium body, low/soft carbonation and slightly syrupy mouth-feel as it warms up. Ok.
UPDATED: FEB 21, 2015 Tap at RR, gold pour, white head, nose is lemon, taste is caramel, bittersweet, good
This taste like a more bitter belgium. Has a carmal color. Has a nutty bitter finish...

A: Dark amber body, smallish off-white head... very little lacing. 

S: Strong spice notes (cinnamon/coriander) with hints of hop bitterness. Nice bready malt notes and pleasant pear aromas. Good yeast notes as well. Earthy.

T: Nice earthy taste. Bready up front. Spicy and bitter in the finish. Lovely candied pear fruit flavor in the middle. The highlight of the profile for me.A

M: Smooth medium body. Dry finish. Alcohol is rather well disguised.

D: A nice beer. Good for a few, but probably not much more than that.

A - copper amber pour with almost no head with nice lacing. 

S - nice dark sour fruits, cinnamon, and subtle toasty caramel malts.

M - nice airy light body with nice creaminess with soft carbonation.

T - nice dark fruits on the nose with some toasted malts, nice floral herbal notes (sage? perhaps) Sweet malty end.

O - overal good biere de garde. 

6+

Draft @ brewpub. Pours darker than expected, a nearly opaque coppery red that when poured into a pitcher (as my neighbors were doing) yields a really thick foamy head with luscious lacing. That way, it looks much more like an ESB than anything else! In the tulip glass, it only has a small tight cap. I wonder if a different glass is warranted. Im thinking mason jar. Anyway, the aroma is of cherry skins, dry fruit. Sophisticated brew, totally true to style and better than many French ones Ive had, by far. The flavors are smooth and balanced with toasted white bread, dark crouton, Melba toast, and dark-skinned fruit. Apple skins. Its also nicely hopped, with a clean crisp finish. If more bieres de garde tasted like this it would be a more popular style. Fun stuff.
Draft at RRBC - No head due to full pour. Dark orange body. Slight aroma. Flavors of sweet citrus and tangerine. Not overly hoppy. Good with food. Clean palate.
On tap at the brewery:  light farmhouse, acidic penny tang to it (in a good way), slight sour, lemon, soapy, bread yeast, flowers, tasty drinkable, salty, complex stuff - 7.8
Draught from brewery.   Pours amber.  Mild head.  Winey and sour but not asa complex as some of the others

Had this on the eve of the August 27th JOs bottle release. Big thanks to Bill for bringing this. ~4 oz from a tasting snifter.

4.0 A: Orange amber color. One finger of white, frothy head. Decent retention and som lacing.

5.0 S: This is outstanding. Super herbalness with some flowers. Wild orchard funk and some hay and barn. Light peach fruitiness.

4.5 T: Great, though somewhat strange, mix of sourish tanginess and flowery herbalness. Light neutral sweetness with hints of light fruits.

4.0 M: Light to lighter medium body. Good creaminess given the body. Moderate carbonation, very nice for a growler.

4.0 D: Very tasty beer. Among the best Ive had from RR. Solid all around. I wish theyd bottle this again.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 08-31-2011 03:02:49
Draft at RR... Murky gold, a bit of peach, light off white head... Weak nose, a touch of caramel but thats it, boring... Pretty blah, light sourness, Id pass in the future

Hazy walnut pour.  Aroma is bread, brown sugar, cinnamon, raisins, lots of brett.  The flavor is malty, spicy bread, more brown sugar and nutmeg, and sweet raisin fruit.  the brett dries it all out very nicely, and a little bit of sweet oxidation makes this an interesting and delicious quaff.  Thanks Chris

On tap at the brew pub, served in a tasting glass. Pours hazy amber with a small, white head. The head fades slowly to a thin cover, leaving behind moderate lace. On the nose, there are notes of sour fruit, along with toasty malts, grain and a slight hint of hops. Coriander and ginger are present as well. The flavour is moderately sour and moderately sweet up front, but the sweetness fades and the sourness picks up towards the end. The finish is long and sour with toasty malts. On the palate, it is light in body with a watery texture and soft carbonation. Overall, this is a nice Bière de Garde with lingering sour fruit and toasty malts. Ginger and nutmeg provide a nice accent throughout. 2011-06-09

Thanks Chris! Dark hazy brown pour with a smallish white head. The nose holds lots of raisin, brown sugar, hints of brett, and some very mild oxidation. The flavor comes in with strong brett notes, culmionating with dark fruit sweetness, and earthen funk. Medium to full body with light carbonation.
Bottle thanks to Chris at Ebenezers. Batch 003. Hazy brown pour. Reminds me of a Christmas version of Orval; dark fruit, spice, yeast, and a lovely dry tart finish. Very nice.

On tap at brewpub. Amber with a creamy off white head. Orange, citrus, bit of funk, and malts. Starts sweet and smooth, has a good balance of hops and belgian spice. Not a huge fan of the style but ok.

A - Served a hazy copper-red color with a finger of off-white head. The head faded slowly leaving behind a nice amount of lace on the sides of the glass.

S - Aroma is a mix of rich sweet toasted caramel malts and fresh light fruits (grape and apricot). There is also just a bit of brown sugar and earthy hops in there.

T - Starts off with some rich slightly toasted caramel malts and light fruit flavors (again grape and apricot mostly). Through the middle, some yeast and bread flavors come through. The finish is a mix of yeast and sweet malts with a bit of the fresh fruit flavor lingering.

M - Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Very smooth and a bit dry. The finish is a really nice mix of sweet and dry as well.

D - Very drinkable. The sweetness provided from the fruit flavors blend really nicely with the rest of the flavors. There is also a really nice dryness throughout the beer.

On tap at RRBC. One of the prettiest pours Ive ever seen. Dark orange with a perfect off white head. Aroma was subtle dark fruit and apricot. Some great yeast notes. Flavor was slightly sweet, a bit yeast and spicy. Some excellent fruit notes.  Excellent beer.

On draught at RRBC.  Pours a deep orange with white head remaining as a collar. Slight lacing. Lots of malt and earthiness on aroma. Slight esters. Chewy yeast mouthfeel. Flavor is mostly yeast and sweet grain.

Sample @ brewery (from notes).  Pours an orange amber color with a medium sized beige head.  The aroma and flavor have caramel malts, some nice fruitiness (pear, apricots), Belgian yeast, with some herbal and earthy hops.  A toasted malt base lies underneath.  Pretty drinkable.
Pours an orange red color with a creamy off white head. Notes of citrus, baseball card bubblegum, and clover. Heavy carbonation.

750 ml Batch 002 bottle shared by phaleslu at 2011 DLD.   Notes of dry toasted bread.   earthy, doughy malts.   spice and black pepper.  slightly vegetal.   light raisin plum skin touch.  pretty good.   held up well.   neat to try.  thanks peter!

750 ml bottle via local trade. Thanks Dan! Batch 002. Shared at DLD11. Pours a deep, dark, cloudy amber color with a big off-white head and some visible sediment in the beer. Aroma of dark fruits, peppery spices, bready malts and yeast, clove, banana, and dry grains. Flavor of toasted malts, pepper, dark fruits (plums, raisins), floral notes, and a bit of earthy funk. Medium-bodied, with abundant soft carbonation and a rich mouthfeel and dry finish. Pretty interesting beer.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2015 From a tap,biscuit flavor,medium body, average carbonation, oily feel, creamy, light sweetness, pale brown,pretty good stuff.

06/26/15 - Carmel bread tasting
bottle of batch 1 thanks to bu11zeye, pour like coca cola with slight skim foam, aroma has cashew, cola and raisin notes, flavors of raisins, molasses and prune,

On tap at the brewery.  This beer has aromas of funk and dry hoppiness with some wet basement smell.  The appearance is a light brownish color with a small off white head.  The taste is very good for the style, with notes of belgian flavors and funkiness.  Very dry finish on this one.  Overall, this is a good brew that pairs well with foods...like the pizza I had at the brewery.
On tap at RR.  A very average beer by the sour masters.  Flavors of caramel, bread, and hard nuts.

On tap at The Toronado 
Appearance: Clear, dark amber with a nice off-white head and good lacing 
Aroma: Pale malts, spices and caramel 
Taste: Caramel, malty, spices, bready and Belgian yeast 
This was a decent beer.

draft at Russian River. Kwak like amber/ brown/ orange pour. Fruity yeastiness, floral sweetness, sweet malts. Bready, floral light bitterness, fruity belgian yeastiness. Good flavor, not horibly complex but still a solid bdg

Draft. Pours a copper brown with a nice off-white head. Aroma of grass, cherry juice with cinnamon and resin in there. Flavor is very malt-forward and sweet, but overall very dry with some floral hops as it warms. Id like to try this again as I only got a sample at the brewery.

Note: This was listed as a Bière de Garde at the brewery, and should be listed with that style.

Tap at Russian River for PtY 2011. On the board as Biere de Sonoma, so Im assuming that means it should be placed under Biere de Garde and not Belgian Ale. The pour is a clear, firey, iced tea amber brown with a small, white head. Aroma is heavy, raw malt; sweet red cherries; cherry juice box. As it warms you are rewarded with cinnamon and spicy/piney hops and sticky resin. Taste is insanely malt forward with raw oatmeal, rye bread, toffee, brown sugar, balanced by earth spices and neutral hops. As it warms you discover numbing cloves, cinnamon, dates, torched red apples. Very malt and fruit driven. Dry body with no sticky sweetness. I think this gets shafted in ratings since its being compared to some of the best beers in the world, but I think this is one that Biere de Garde fans can rejoice in. Great example of a malt forward beer.

Draft. Poured clear brown color with an average fizzy off-white head that was fully lasting with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy toasted malt, yeast and fruit aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Moderate to heavy toasted sweet flavor with a medium to heavy smooth sweet finish of moderate to long duration. Good drinkable beer.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2011 Sample at the brewpub. Pours a hazy brownish-amber color with a medium thin light beige head that diminishes steadily. RIngs of lacing on the glass. Fruity aroma with notes of roasted malt and yeast. Medium body with flavors of toasted malt, caramel, yeast and fruit. The finish is tart apples and yeast. Above average overall.

On tap at Russian River. The pour is a beautiful auburn haze with medium off-white head. Aroma is cinnamon potpourri, oak, and pine. Flavor starts with sweet butterscotch, followed by currants and cinnamon, followed by oak and bourbon, and followed by flowers. It gets increasingly hoppy as it warms. Some really nice dark, bready sweet qualities to go with the hoppiness.
Tap at the source.  Bright amber, beige head.  Plain caramel aroma and flavor, but nice balance.

On tap at the brewery in August 2009.

A: Pours an amber/red with a white head.

ST: Caramel malt with some candied sugars and some spicy Belgian yeast; a little bit of earthiness going on as well. Some floral hops.

M: Medium bodied and smooth. Good amount of carbonation.

D: Quite drinkable. A very interesting beer--big fan of this one, especially coming from a style Im not always particularly fond of.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 10-04-2009
Draft. An amber beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has notes of malt and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, and hops making it quite spicy, leading to a bitter finish.

On tap at Fathers Office.  Orange-red pour, with white head.  Aroma includes dark malt, spice, caramel, touch of oak, dark fruit. Taste is earth, spice, caramel, nuts, vanilla.  Complex, drinkable.  Good stuff.
On tap. Golden, white head.  Medium body.  Sweet malt with a light sour/yeasty note.  Some spice.  Great.
From the tap poured a dark straw color with a good amount of head.  Strong malty flavor with a lingering finish.

A: snifter. pours a deep, copper color with a ton of ruby highlights, nice thick off-white head, some sediment floating throughout the beer. great head retention and phenomenal lacing.

S: tons of fruits, from berries to plums. I am picking up some spices, some clove and white pepper. Some bread-like aromas.

T: Some nice roasted malts up front with some dark fruits accompanying them, as it warms i pick up the pepper and spice. Serious plum flavors. Finish is what I expected with a biere de garde, a little light but very nice.

M: Very carbonated but not in a bad way. medium bodied. rather crisp.

D: very drinkable like pretty much everything Russian River brews. I was very luck to get some of this and hope to get some more in the near future. Definitely worth a try.
Draft at the brewery. This seemed like it had some biere de garde flavors to me. A hint of astringency and bready, malt notes. Pretty tasty but also some what subtle.

A: The pour is a heavily orange tinted amber color, perhaps we could call it copper, with a creamy off-white head.

S: The nose is full of yeasty esters. Lots of banana, apple, and pears. A slight spice component is there as well, which goes nicely with the sweet and bready malt.

T: Quite a sweet beer, but most Belgian styles are. Lots of caramel, brown sugar, bananas, cinnamon, and nutmeg. The bread flavor is a bit more in the background and allows the other flavors to shine.

M: The body is medium with a middle of the road carbonation.

D: Im not always the biggest fan of Biere de Garde (some just seem to be very poorly done), but like most other Russian River beers, I liked this. Nice flavors and yeast notes, solid all around.

Had on tap at RR brewpub.  Not quite sure what a "Biere de Sonoma" was, but the waiter explained it as just a local brew, of Belgian style.  So yeah, a Belgian Ale (wrote Golden Ale in my notes).  Pours a nice hazy amber color with good carbonation.  Aroma is mostly malts, spice, and fruit.  Taste was again mostly malts with a hit of alcohol in the middle.  Finishes slightly bitter with a finish that didnt linger too long.  Solid, but not my favorite.
At brewery.  Pours cloudy amber.  Caramel apple, spicy, nutmeg.  Delicious.

Sampled at the brewpub in Santa Rosa. Pours deep brown with a bit of head on it. Very good solid malty texture to it. Really well crafted and you can taste the spiciness to it. Palate is nice and aftertaste is smooth.

Pours a hazy caramel color with an orange head. The aroma is Belgian yeast spicy with heavy notes of pear, apple, and orange. The flavor is very sweet and spicy. The fruity apple and pears show up strong with some hints of caramel. Very fresh fruit flavor. It end on a slight citrus peel bitterness at the tail end.

My Bottom Line:
Crunchy cereals, mild herbal hops and timid esters coexist peacefully in this friendly Belgian-style Ale.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A creamy sheet of foam decorates the hazy burnt amber. 
-Vinnies beers seem to always brilliantly showcase the base cereals used in the aroma; this one is no exception.
-There are lots of subtleties to be tasted yet nothing stands out much or is memorable. 
-Fruity esters are relatively tame for a Belgian Ale, which in this case tends to increase drinkability. 
-The mouthfeel is quite crisp even though the malts are prominent throughout.

On tap at the brewpub.

I had this as part of the 16 beer sampler (enjoyed with my future wife..couldnt do it all alone). This was one of the more unusual ones because its aroma and appearance tricked me into thinking it would taste a certain way.  It had a strawberry aftertaste, which for me might explain the description of "cinnamon and pear".  It fooled me since there was no aroma and it looked like a lager.  Not bad at all.
Sampled at Russian River in Santa Rosa. Pours a light honey amber. Something of an undercarbonated American pale with a bit of Belgian yeast, giving it a *slight* tart kick.

Courtesy of jdubFL. 2 liter swing top growler pours hazy murky copper with gold edges and thin white head. The aroma pushes up peach and apricot as well as spicy and tart notes and then fruity sweetness at the end of the draw. The taste is really smooth with fruitiness and spice and then moving into growing tart and sour notes by midway. I get only a sense of the barrel aging oak far off in the background.

Bottle Hazy amber ale with a large, fizzy, white head. Fantastic, creamy retention. The nose is funky, earthy and leathery with a note of vinyl that doesnt quite work for me. Medium-bodied and dry with fizzy carbonation. Tastes funky, fruity and lightly acidic. Mild bitterness and coriander spiciness. Finishes corny and dry. Not a big fan, but the beer is solid.

Perdition is a good looking dark golden Belgian with a foamy head. The beer smells earthy and a bit yeasty. Its a pleasant Belgian aroma. The taste is complex and unique in my experience. Its a bit like a sweet farmhouse ale. Its fruity with a lot of earthiness. There are hops but RR has toned down their normal flavors well to allow for a more complex, more Belgian character. Its a very drinkable beer with a smooth feel.
On tap at the brewpub. Dark amber with a thin head. Aroma-smoky, earth, yeast, caramel, barn. Taste-smooth malt with some light barn/ashtray notes. Good, medium finish.

On draft at Russian River (Santa Rosa, CA): Pours out clear golden, topped with a creamy white head and spotty lacing. Aroma of pale malts, light barnyard funk, cracked wheat, light roast, brown sugar, raisin, cherry, and lots of orange peel. Creamy, nutty flavor with more malts. Moderate hints of hop in the taste gives a slightly oily mouthfeel. Drinkability: Enjoyably sweet. Pairing: Sauteed salmon. Rebuy: Yes. #353 on 30032010. DG.

On tap at the brewery/pub on PtY release 10.  Pours a clear amber with a white head.  Nose is of nut, yeast and bread.  Taste is yeast and nut.  Mouthfeel is medium and dry.  Not fantastic, but better than Redemption was.

On tap at Russian River. Shit, I have tried so many of their beers on tap in one day (from a notepad). Nice fluffy head sitting on top of a darker coppery brown colored body. Head fades away slowly. Slight haze and translucent appearance. Seems like my nose is picking up some spicy aroma. Belgian yeast aroma is coming through. There is also a sweet sugar aroma being sniffed as well. This beer is quite refreshing and not as thick as other Belgian Ales tend to be. The sugar and yeast-like flavors dominate. Nothing is really popping out at me. Honestly, from one Belgian Ale to the next, I am not getting huge differences i.e. going from Redemption to this doesnt really seem to be a big jump. I will say Redemption was more assertive, aggressive, bold, or what have you. This one is a little boring in my opinion, seeing that nothing really jumps out at me and makes me say "Wow!". Slight touches of fruit are being picked up as well.
On tap at Lucky Baldwins...dark golden orange pour with a white head...Aroma is belgian yeast..slight bite with belgian yeast..verry drinkable.

@Toronadoon tap-pours an off white head and hazy amber color.  Aroma is medium fruit-orange, creamy, hay/light/medium malt-caramel.  Taste is medium fruit, creamy, hay/light/medium malt-caramel.  Some herbal hops.
UPDATED: MAR 19, 2010 Pours copper, aroma is all bread and biscuit. Flavor is also bready, with some belgian flavors and a little tang.
On tap at Obriens.  Copper pour.  Fruit, sweetness, bready malt, spice, and some pear.  Good belgain ale, but not nock your socks off.
On tap at brewery: Chewy texture with a smooth carbonation level; great mouthfeel. Richly flavored, with sweet caramel, earth, and a bit of funk. Herbal hops. Lingering notes of yeast. Tasty beer.

Pours a dark golden orange color with golden amber hues when held to a light source and a two finger frothy white head with excelent retention, only slowly fading into a lasting cap that streaks the glass with lacing.

Slightly spicy yeasty aroma with hints of peper and a subtle light fruit notes, mostly apple and pear.

Slightly earthy yet sweet medium body with a buteer silk mouthfeel, very subtle hops and some nice light crisp fruit. Lotsof apple and pear and possibly some grape with a nice maltiness underneath and a spicy slightly dry finish.

(Sample Date: 7/18/2009   Source:Other)   Courtesy of TheBeerGod. Batch 1 Perdician. Fruity raisin sugary maltyness in aroma with Belgian yeast spiciness. Cloudy orange amber with small white head. Grain with a spicy light fruitiness follows aroma. Finish is medium with a spicy residual bitterness.
Draught at Russian River.  Loved this. Belgian ale that mixes a light blonde taste (traditional sense) with a dark body. Fruity in flavor.  A unique take on the biere de garde style.

Poured into a chimay goblet, rusty amber brown with a nice cloud-like head. 
Nose was heavy on dark fruits, spices, belgian sugar. 
Taste was nice and light on the yeast, which was a nice change of pace for style. good amount of pear, peach, and plum. Holiday spices round out a very flavorful yet non-traditional profile. Really a nice and slightly brighter change of pace from belgian strongs.
30th August 2008. Pale Ale, Biere Du Garde and Brown Ale hybrid. In actuality a slightly haxy brown beer with a very delicate touch of sourness and a dry finish. Different but not outstanding.

Batch 3 bottle thanks to Zinister! Transparent red-copper with a fluffy beige head. Malty nose of brown sugar, raisin, cherry, and light alcohol. Creamy, nutty flavor of more fruit, brown sugar, and malt. An odd, dry bitterness in the finish, slightly off, coupled with hints of hop. This one defies classification, probably best described as a quaffable belgian strong ale. Not among RRs best, but still quite enjoyable.

On tap at Fathers office. Poured a dark copper amber color with little head. Aroma of belgian yeast with a bit of spice and sweetness. Taste of maltiness, fresh spices, pears. Very smooth with good aftertaste.
On tap at Stone 9/14.  Orange amber with thick lace.  Gooey, thick, gross looking lace.  In a good way, obviously.  Taste is lightly yeasty and malty.  Eh.

Batch 1, Bottle courtesy of TheBeerGod at Immys Backyard Throwdown. Pours cloudy brown in color with tan head. Aroma roasted malt, sweet and spicy. Taste roasted malt, caramal and spicy with bitter finish.
On tap at the brewpub in Santa Rosa.  Golden amber with a lacing white head.  Nose is both fruity and spicy.  Flavor is the same, spicy, white pepper, a little Belgian Candy, sweet.  Sticky finish.
Poured clear golden amber, malty,  caramel, grainy, yeasty, spicey, little fruity.

On tap. Clear amber golden with a dense off-white head leaving laces. Aroma of yeast and a little Brett. Medium body, very, very sweet malts and fruit. Somewhat astringent and leathery Brett finish. 110709
Bottle thanks to bu11zeye. Brown in color with a medium off-white head. Aroma is of grain and caramel. Taste is of grain, yeast, caramel and spices.

Bottle courtesy of TheBeerGod on 07/18/2009. Batch 1. Cloudy brown bdoy with a medium creamy off-white head. Sweet spicy peppery aroma with some sugary notes and some light fruit. Sweet peppery flavor with some caramel and light fruity notes. Medium body with moderate carbonation.

On tap at Fathers Office Santa Monica. Pours amber with thick of white head. Aroma is yeast, dark fruit, spices and malt. Flavor is bready malts, yeast, dark fruit and some hops. Good amount of spice and not overly yeasty. Nice Belgain Ale.

From tap at the brewpub. Pours clear and golden orange with a small off-white head. Aroma is roasted malt and phenols. Teabag hoppy and slight fruity hops flavoured, medium dry and with a light golden malt base. Mild fruity and phenolic finish.

Nice soft palate. Im liking that about RR beers. Thought the brewers description was spot on for this beer, cinnamon, pear, lots of spices, tons of spices like clove, nutmeg, sweet malts. Very good.
Tap at RR.Clear golden body, with a small white head. Aroma is sweet, spicy, and fruity. Flavor is malt, spices and hops. Delicious.

On tap at Russian River. Pours a clear golden with a white head. Dry with aromas of honey. Notes of perfume and hints of brett. Also some grass and hay. Medium body and carbonation. Bitter finish with residual sugars and hints of grass.

750 mL bottle courtesy of TheBeerGod at Immys Backyard Throwdown (Batch 1, bottled 06/06/06).  Pours dark orange with a fizzy white head (my notes mention this is similar in color to a DIPA).  Toffee sweet aroma; some tart citrus notes as well.  Very well balanced tart sourness and peppery spiciness.  This one was quite enjoyable.
@ Immy Backyard Throwdown. Batch 1. Poured a brown color. The aroma was a strong citrus. Its taste was very hoppy and bitter. With a taste of coffee as well.

Batch 1 bottle shared by TheBeerGod at Immys Backyard Throwdown. Thanks! Pours a muddy brown color with a medium head. Average head retention and lacing. Spicy, herbal aroma with toffee and tart fruit notes. Taste is caramel, herbal notes and chocolate. Full bodied.
Nice foamy head. Very lacy.  Brown red at  top, gets lighter toward bottom.  Crisp, alcohol presence.  Caramel notes?

Tap at RR. Deep amber color, aroma is sweet fruits, caramel. Same on tasting, with some yeast notes, light spices, and slight hoppy bitterness on the finish that offers a nice balance to the upfront sweetness. Nice brew.
Wow, Surpisingly hoppy finish! Great to find this beer in LA at Fathers Office with Z and Shank. Watery front end, mild dark fruits( dates, raisins). Hopped back end. Surpisingly dark amber in color.

Bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  The look is clear, red amber in color.  The smell is malts, caramel, sweet, wheat, florals. spices, and yeast.  The taste is yeast, sweet, caramel, yeast, malts, wheat, and spices.

Pours a caramel/amber looking color.  Aroma was vague out of the sample glass, but there was a hint of belgian yeast.  Tastes of caramel, bread, dirt and grass.  Finishes with burned caramel, toast, and crust.  Medium bodied and easy going.  More an amber ale than belgian ale?  Seemed so to me.

On tap at the Russian River Brewpub. Pours a clear copper body with a thin, white head that leaves lots of nice, soft lacing. Aroma is an herbal musk and woody with lots of mild spices and yeast. Some light caramels, toasted toffees, nuts, and citrus. More musky and spicy than sweet. Flavor is similar with more noticeable earthy citrus. Somewhat sweeter with some bready malts and Belgian characteristics, but still presents itself as musky. A touch of dark candi sugar with lots of herbal spices. Good amount of pine in the finish with some pepper and cinnamon. Lingers with lots of herbal spicing, wood, and citrus. Dry in the finish with a medium body. Overall, an interesting beer. Lots going on and a nice balance, but its hard to pick out some of these flavors. Still enjoyeable, however.
My notes were boiled down to numbers only at this point, not much in the way of description at this point of the night.  The keywords were malty sweet, caramel, spices (clove?), and some farmhouse.

Bottle.  Hazy amber color, and even with a careful pour there was plenty of sediment (and something that looked like a small leech, no joke).  Aroma was yeasty and spicy. Flavor was decently balance, plenty of malt, caramel and finished very spicy.  Decent beer, but I probably wont trade to get this one again.
batch 001 bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  deep amber color with an off white head.  caramel, leather, toffee and raisins for the aromas.  very smooth on the palate with a flavor of raisins and fruit.

Bomber obtained through a trade at Dark Lord Day 2009 shared with soccer290. This was apparently from the 2006 batch. When I opened this brew, it foamed out of the top a little bit. This made me think that it was not properly stored. It poured a very nice deep copper color with a two finger width tan head that stuck around for a while and left nice lacing on the glass. The aroma was pretty bland; caramel malt, hops, and some citrus fruit. The taste was good but was fairly weak. It had a decent hop character to it with some hints of fruit and malt in the background. It got pretty bitter as the beer warmed though. Overall, I decent brew but nothing too exciting.

22 oz bottle acquired by trade at DLD 09, shared with General66. Unfortunately, it was stored poorly, and resulted in a bad pour. Huge head with a copper color. Smells of dried fruit, caramel malt, hops, and some spice. Taste is very similar, with the malt being more pronounced. Interesting beer, but I would have rated it higher if it were stored properly.

750mL bottle shared by Georgiabeer at the Brick Store.

Pours a dark hazy amber with a solid head that dissipates to a soapy cap and leaves great lacing.

The aroma is a combination of earthy aromas with a hint of funk and some sweet light fruits.  The earthy aromas come in the form of oak tannins, spicy belgian yeast and some toasted malts.  The fruits are pears, apples and may some darker fruits like raisins.  Interesting combination in the nose.

The taste has the backbone of the Belgian yeast, which leaves a slightly spicy finish, and toasted malts, which lend to a slightly dry finish.  These are supplemented by pears and apples and even some earthy hops, though theyre almost faded at this point.

The mouthfeel is light to medium bodied with good carbonation.

I cant say that Ive tried many biere de gardes but this is certainly one of the better ones Ive tried to date.  Thanks Robert!

Bottle thanks to bu11zeye. Pours a hazy amber with nice off-white head. Aroma of some farmhouse, fruit, malt, and spice, very nice. Flavor is malty, farmhouse, fruit, spices I cant identify. Mouthfeel is medium body with fizzy carbonation. Overall, pretty good shit!!!!!!!
(750ml bottle, Batch 001)  Pours a clear amber body with a medium white head.  Aroma of mustiness, yeast, florals, and cinnamon.  Flavor of yeast, light citrus, coriander, bread, and cinnamon.

On tap at Fathers Office 2.

Lovely beer.  Being the third or fourth time Ive had this beer, it was about time for me to actually review it!  

This gorgeous beer adorns the glass with some of the best lacing I have ever seen.  The mouthfeel is delicate and smooth as silk.  Notes of raisins and figs mingle with a delightful, soft funk in the nose.  These flavors carry over into the taste along with a balanced spiciness.  

Very well executed.  Eminently drinkable while being unique and complex enough to keep you interested.
pours a dark amber with a thin white head. Malty nose with some belgian tones. Toasty malt, some sweet caramel notes.

Tap at the brewpub: Effervescent golden with a dense off white head. Spicy fruit skin aroma- fresh peach, prune, nice yeast notes with subtle dry phenolics. Creamy dense carbonation. The flavor has a nice spicy and sweet fruit presence. Mild candied citruses mesh with mild peach and herbal/smooth chamomile-like notes. The finish is dry and lightly peppery with a bread crust note. A solid Biere de Garde.

On tap @ the brewpub.  Chalkboard states 6.10% ABV and 23 IBUs.  Clear copper orange with a one finger beige head.  Candied pears and spicy Belgian yeast up front with some toasted malts, caramel, and a bit of an earhty backdrop.  Flavor adds just a hint of tart cherries, though I hesitate to call it tart, as its so mild.  There is also a hint of unripened apricots.  Earthy herbal hop spicy dry finish with bitterness around a 3 (and a half!).  Low prickly carb with a smooth medium body.  Pretty good.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: Draught at the brewpub.   Amber with a fine white head.   Malty caramel, and strong bubble-gum aroma.   The flavor is spicy and hoppy with caramel sweetness, bubble-gum, earthy spice, and a bitter finish.   Medium-light bodied and smoothly carbonated.   The spice and bubble-gum are just a bit too much.

On tap at OBriens Russian River night. Pours a dark amber-brown with a white ring. Big sweet aroma, of hops, brown sugar, and a little soapy. Huge rich taste, of sugar, banana, plum, malt, and wood. Lingering sharp-sweetness. Tasty.

750ml batch 002 courtesy of KingG, thanks! My bottle was listed as 6.6% ABV on the label This is already a year or so old (according to the RR bottle log) so this should give me a good idea of whether or not to age my other bottle (batch 003). nice, ruby-red and brown mixture with a nice ring of bubbles and a thin white film. It looks good. the first whiff is a metallic, earthy smell that I also picked up from Redemption. Just like Redemption the mineral aroma fades as it warms and leaves behind a very fruity juiciness. It almost like cutting open a lemon or watermelon but not exactly. The funny thing is that while it is not a strong aroma it begs you to take one whiff after another, very cool. The flavor is bready, malty, spicy, some hops I think and maybe citrus. The thing I like about this beer is that the aroma and flavor are very good yet very subtle. It really begs you to think about what you are drinking. There is also an odd flavor that makes me think of authentic Belgians as opposed to craft Belgian-style beers. Maybe it is RRs yeast because Redemption gave me the same feeling. In any case, definitely let this warm up and you will be rewarded.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 06-10-2008 02:20:50
on tap at stone. slightly brownish looking ale, tasted almost ESB-like, without much distinguishing notes of flavor. dissappointed.

Pours ruby/garnet hue, moderate off-white head, good clarity. Nose of dark fruity esters, sweet toffee, toast, and caramel, hints of resin. Sweet fruity esters hit first, mostly grapes/pears, moderate hop bitterness, low-no hop flavor, toasty and toffee malts creep in, moderate alcohol warmth, clean and crisp, finishes medium-high dryness. Medium-bodied, smooth texture, moderate-high prickly carbonation. Overall a fairly strong flavored, malt-forward Belgian with nice balance between fruits and bitters, easy-drinking

On tap at Russian River.  Im a big fan of this so-called "Biere de Sonoma." Brownish red with an off-white head.  Aroma is spices, yeast, pear, banana, and some funk.  Flavors of nuts and light fruit esters with a slight Saison-ish quality.  Smooth palate.  I like it.

Draft at OBriens Russian River night.  Pours a blood orange/ copper color with a small off white head.  Light spice on the nose as well as some citrus fruits and Belgian yeast.  Flavor was sweet, yeasty and funky......good stuff.
OBriens 15th annv, nice beer.  Spicy and lite.  Little funk and well made.  Not one of my favorite styles.  Yeasty with not the longest finish.  Prob more enjoyable with food or cheese.
Pour from the tap at OBriens. Golden color with a white head. Aromas of yeast and bread. Fruity banana flavor. Kinda thin mouthfeel. Not my favorite.

On tap at Fathers offie in LA.  Typical uninteresting Belgian aroma.  Flavor is wierd -- astringent with a bit of a burnt rubber feel.  Overall:not bad by any means, not what I wanted from RR.  Sour please.

Tap at RR.  Pours a lightly hazy golden copper with a medium wonderfully creamy off white head that left tons of lacing.  Aroma of banana, clove, cinnamon, spicy Belgian yeast esters, lemon and earthy notes.  Flavor was much of the same with the banana and yeast easters up front.  Biscuit and a light sweetness.  Great creamy mouthfeel.

Draft @ the brewpub. Pours a clear amber color with a small off-white head. Has a malty earthy spicy aroma with some hoppy hints. Malty earthy caramel flavor with some spicy hints. Has a slightly sweetish malty caramel finish with some spicy hints and some hints of yeast in the aftertaste.

(10/28/08) Draught sample at the brewpub in Santa Rosa. Copper-colored beer. Aroma of malt, caramel, light cookie hints and some spicy hops. Sweetish malty flavor with some fruitiness and a dry finish with spicy notes. Medium-bodied.

batch 003 graciously shared at mi casa by sparky27...

pours a rich coppery brown with a medium sized off white head. this is actually a beautiful looking beer...

intoxicatingly sweet, rich and robust smell... lots of bready yeast, brown sugar, grapes/raisins, overripe danjou pears, flowers and some earthy spices.

ouch!... this actually hurts me its so sweet! the aroma carries over to the flavor with the addition of a punch in the teeth dose of sugar. it does have a spicy yeasty finish but, at that point its too late. the medium body is syrupy and thick with sugar.

its just not doing it for me.
8/4/5/2/12/3.1
On tap at the brewpub.  Caramelly orange in the color.  Aroma of lightly toasted malt, yeast, wheat, banana and caramel.  Flavor was very similar and slightly sweet.  Minimal amount of hopping. Nice.

Sample courtesy of Sparky27 at the hellbilly holiday tasting. This one threw me for a loop. Detected a floral earthly aroma. Dark golden body with tan head. A rustic fruity flavor. Odd brew for my palate I quess. Thanks Eric.

Sample courtesy of Sparky27 at the hellbilly holiday tasting.  Deep amber pour with a nice creamy tan head.  Aroma of toasted malt, light fruit and yeast.  A lightly sweet flavor of caramel malt, pears, banana, yeast and spice.  Hint of hops on the very dry finish.  Crisp carbonation.  Very nice session brew.  Thanks Eric!
UPDATED: JAN 5, 2009 on tap at RR.  Beautiful light brown/copper color.  Very biscuity/bready up front with lingering light spiciness.
Strong malt through out with a small bit of metal.  Very nutty, no normal Belgian taste.  Very odd for style.  Not the biggest fan, but its still great.

25 oz bottle, batch 001.  Pours a clear amber body with a moderate off-white fizzy head.  A good bit of carbonation.  Nice soft toasty malts with a great brett character.  Very basic and delicate.  The flavor is actually pretty thin, very light toasty malt with a slight sweetness up front.  The finish is dominated by the yeasts, especially the brett, with some soft horseblanket and dusty earthiness.  Mouthfeel is light bodied with a fairly thin texture, lots of nice pinpoint fizzy carbonation.  Overall, can’t say that I really was into this one, there just wasn’t much going on.  Either this was just too subtle, or the age had eroded the hops and spices and boosted the brett character.

Draft, brewpub. Pours very clear, deep ruby colored with a fat soapy white head.  Aroma is banana, pear, and some pungent, resinous grapefruit rind character that I cant tell comes from the yeast or hops.  Taste is very fruity, estery and phenolic with lots of banana type flavors and some cheesiness.  Pretty much right on for a Belgian ale.  Nice and authentic if not exactly special.
Tap @ RR. Clear orange color, short head. Aomra of some toast, caramel, herbal. Bit spicy, bit dry, some juniper? Light brandy.

Growler from IowaHerkeye (Thanks Joey).  Pours a clear copper color.  Bit of a spicy aroma, not a lot.  Very clean taste with a nice spice hint and good malty finish.  Clean crisp hop in the background.  Would be a great session beer.
On tap @ RR.  Pours a clear, dark amber color with a nice tan head.  Spicy, yeasty aroma, cloves, bananas.  Malty body, finishes with more spice, bread, and light fruit.  Decent.

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2008 Pours a really clear and pretty brown with a red tint.  Lasting beige head that clings a bit to the side of the glass.  Really good cinnamon character with some plum or date character, but with out the sweetness of the actual fruit.  Really malty flavor with plenty of spice and fruit flavor.  Really pretty complex.  Medium body with well rounded edges.  Finish is very balanced.  The aftertaste sort of explodes in the mouth and gives you time to reflect a bit before you need to take another drink.  Perdition immediately becomes one of my favorite Russian River offerings.

Sampler at the RR Brewpub (Santa Rosa, CA). Pours a coppery hue with a nice small white head. Aromas indicate some darker Belgian notes, yeasty spiciness and dark fruits. Taste is similar, more intesnse with somestrong fruit notes, cherries and belgian yeasty characteristics. Finishes smooth with some warming notes. Enjoyable, albeit not necessarily what I was looking for.

Piny candied hop aroma. Syrupy sweet cherries, with some smooth acidic notes. 
Pours a transparent amber orange, beautifully carbonated head with some light lacing around the glass. 
Strong fruit flavor upfront, cherries, strawberries, peaches, with just a touch of hops, followed by a smooth sweet finish. 
Palate is full and rich. Very tasty.

This is another great Belgian ale from Russian River.  It is ruby red with brown hints, medium lasting off-white head, decent lace but slightly weaker han redemption.  The aroma is fruit, grain, a hint of stewed prunes, and overall quite nice.  The taste is dryish but not too dry, stopping just short of being bitter with a mild sweetness.  It tastes of lightly stewed fruit, zesty, with light toasted grain, hint of bread and caramelized fruit, hints pf wine and dryish, peppery finish. It’s smooth but compared to redemption has a bit more bite.
Draught. Spicy nose, cherry and musky hops with some grains. Clear dark mahogany with a very thin head. Spicy and fruity flavor with lots of carbonation into a dry finish. Full-bodied mouthfeel.

Pours a dark brown in color.  There are some ruby highlights and a very good amount of head on the pour.  Smell is some dark fruit, lots of belgian yeast and then some citrusy hop finish on the end.  You get even more of the light citrusy fruit flavor in the taste.  I wasn’t expecting that at all from the color of the beer.  Decent beer, but many more I would take over this.
Pours a cloudy brown with a think tan head.    Fruit, pepper, and belgian yeast aroma.    Creamy texture and some mild spice.  Good, but not as good as some of their other Belgians.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2008 Bottle shared by TAR, thanks man.  Poured a deep reddish-brown color with a moderate, tight white head that receded to a layer and left thick rings of lacing.  Aroma of earthy yeast and some floral, grassy hops, a light herbal character, and an almost mint-like, spicy aroma.  Smooth, lightly toasted malt with some moderate toffee and a hint of brown sugar lead into a floral, spicy hop hit with some soft fruity undertones and a lightly dry finish.  Smooth, light carbonation.  Quite a nice beer, thanks Jeff.

Deep amber colored beer with an authentic Belgian foam.  Large, fluffy head lasts really well.  Dry & Fruity nose, peppery, yeasty, dank and authentic aroma.  Spicy hop flavors, with pepper and spice.  Herb-like hops, with tea-like flavors.  Really nice authentic beer.

draft @ brewery - wow, this was my fav from the pub visit and id love to get some more; dark gold with thin white head and lots of lacing going down; aromas of slight spice, bread, sweet malts and grainy yeast; very rich and creamy texture; this is a very subtle and delicate brew; flavors of mild spice and fruit; certainly not their biggest brew, but one of their best

Aug 25, 2008: 750 mL bottle, corked & caged (Batch 001, aged 2 years): Very similar mahogany color as I remember, but this time it has a noticeable purple hue...another generous head, light tan in colour, that though diminishing, remains as a soft cream on top and climbing up the edges of the glass.  These malts have depth!  Toasted grains so robust it is as if they were smoked, not just cooked...fruity malt so ripe it is thick and juicy with a hint of tartness.  Dark tannins and lemon pepper tingle the tongue.  Palate is a touch gritty, not quite as smooth as before.  Definitely has mellowed over time...but in a way that showcases the beauty of the beer: the deep malts and subtle (and not so subtle at times) yeast.  8/5/9/4/17: 4.3  
Aug 19, 2006: 750 mL bottle, corked & caged (Batch 001, fresh): Gorgeous mahogany with a very generous ivory cream.  Iron flavoured spices and a balancing toasted malt presence make for a deeply complex aroma with black pepper, bitter honey and wonderful floral accents...roasted grains fill the mouth and the creamy and smooth palate is a perfect match.  Bright, lemony qualities on the back of the tongue before getting wrapped up by sweet bubblegum.  Great beer!  8/5/8/5/17: 4.3

1st.... quite excited to try this with a big turnout ... is quite dry yet a bit spunky ... is a delicious brew indeed ... pours a golden somewhat brown colour, with a good head/foam .... has some fun yeast floaties, ..an enjoyable brew that shows great promise on future RR brews...

~Pours a light caramel color with lasting white head.
~Caramel malt scent with light hops.
~Has a woodsy hop taste with mild malts. Nice balance.
~Quick clean finish, some bitterness at finish.
~Nice brew.

In short: Halfway between a Brown Ale and a spicy Belgian Ale.  Good different beer. 
How: Bottle 750ml, consumed when probably around 4 months old.  Sent my way vy WeeHeavySD, thanks a lot Jon.
The look: Cloudy amber body topped by a small beige head
In long: Nose is intriguing, I could smell peat, lots of grass, strong spicy notes and that always pleasant wild yeast with its farmhouse hints.  Like the nose, taste was also pretty much all over the place.  Dry wood, roasted nuts, tree roots, toasted bread, dry wood, peat and green grass, pepper and other spices.  Overall the beer is pretty dry.  Short but very sharp and biting bitterness.  Did I notice an alcohol bite in a 6% beer?!?  I dont know whether or not the beer is actually spiced but I thought it was too spicy too strong for its own good.  The beer is more all over the place than complex per say yet its definitely something Id like to have more often if it was available in my area.  Ha Russian River craftbeers!  My family always told me that this kind of beer would be my perdition, almost right, this Perdition is my kind of beer.

Batch 003.  Pours a dark, hazy, copper brown color with burnt sienna hues.   A huge, frothy, khaki colored head displays excellent retention, sticking around until the very last sip and leaving jagged flares and patches of fine lace on the glass.  The aroma shows malty notes of hazelnut, caramel, chocolate cake, and toasted biscuit.  Floral and citrus hop notes lend fruity bitterness, while a dry, musty yeast and hints of creamy lactose tie everything together.  Flavors start out quite roasty, transitioning to notes of walnuts, dry cocoa, earthy hops, and citrus rinds.  Dry yeast and a heaping dose of oaky vanilla complete the experience.  Medium-full bodied and incredibly smooth, the carbonation is lively but ultra-fine in texture.  Finishes dry, as do all Russian River beers.  This is an excellent brew that defies a singular classification.
Shared by ???.  Malty tasting  beer which was descent but nothing to write home about.

750ml courtesy of BOLTZ7555.  Pours clear amber with a big 3 finger off white head and great lacing.  Nose is light yeast, spice and slight citrus hops.  Taste is sweet malt, citrus, Belgian yeast and spice with a mild resin finish.  Medium mouth feel.  Interesting brew   thanks Jason!
On tap at RR.  Pour was brown/tan color with a big fluffy head.  Nose is fruity, malty, and lightly spiced (hops?).  Taste is also fruity, malty, and a little tart. Mouth is stickey.
malty flavors dominate, not really a memorable beer its not bad just not special either
on tap at brewpub.  Nice belgian ale.  Aroma is all yeast and malts with whiff of hops. Flavor pretty much matches the commercial description.

750ml bottle from ASymon13 on BA - thanks Andrew! I didn’t read the label description before pouring this one, and so I was surprised to see how brown it was. But oh what a bounty on the nose, rising cleanly from the deep earthy body and the fluffy, lasting head. Strong yeast, perky citrus hops, dry spice, subtle sugary malts. The yeast characteristics are definitely dominant, but like holdenn says below, it’s probably categorizable as a wild brown. Long papery dry finish a la biere de gardes. Extremely good.

750 ml bottle Batch 03.  Enjoyed with a game of horseshoes.  Brown orange in color with a beige creamy head that laces down.  This nose is hard to place at first, so I’ll start with the obvious. Brown sugar, nutty, spicy, and yeasty.  Then there is that familiar grassy note.  Fresh wort.  It distinctly smells and tastes strongly of fresh unfermented wort.  Not in overwhelming sweetness but the fresh malts and grassy fresh fresh hops.  Those green grass hops are all over the flavors with a nutty sweetness.  A really strange beer.  Like an unfermented and wild brown ale.  Decent, but not something I would go back for.
Growler from golubj. There is a fair bit of malt flavor in this covered in spicy yeast and some nice fruity notes beneath. Nice pour, nice head. Quite drinkable and rather mild. A nice beer.
Draft at the brewpub.  Amber pour.  Toasty nutty caramel malt aroma.  flavor is pretty much the same, some earthy hops and grain.  Like a strange variation of a brown ale.

On tap at Father’s Office. Pours with an off-white head covering a clear amber body. Aroma is quite malty with grapes, pear and a bit spicey. Taste is slightly sour and fruity, extremely malty finishing a bit nutty. Syrupy mouthfeel, slightly fizzy.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2009 A very drinkable Belgian, wo knowswhat to expect from RR but it was easy drinking.  Some sourness yes but Ive had more sour from them.  Spicy saison charcter.  Medium brown with a big head and lacey. Great mouthfeel.  Balanced malt and bitterness, the spice and the sour element.

In the bottle. Very nice dark copper color, very good head retention. Slight hop smell in the aroma. Seemed a bit thin and watery, very smooth though. Kind of expected more from RR. Not horrible, but not great either.
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: there was definately a lot going on here.  this is a rare occasion, but i would have actually liked less hop flavor in this ale.  lots of spicy and fruity, and toasty characters all fighting with each other.  i have another bottle, so hopefully in a year or so the flavors will smooth out and work together instead of fighting with each other.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2008 750 ml bottle shared with sammy and hyde. sammys bottle. my first russian river brew and truely something i wasnt expecting ever to be able to try. thanks sammy for opening this one. pours deep amber with a lovely tan head. very complex aroma. pale malts with some sour aspects. belgian qualities poke out through the nose here and there. i really dont think i could put any style to this one. flavours are woody, some brett that has really drawn quite a bit from the barrel, hops that i wasnt expecting. very very easy to drink but the layers of flavours and complexity were mind blowing. thanks again sammy!

On-tap at the brewery. Pours orange/brown with a moderate white head, good lace. Smells malty and earthy sweet. Tastes malty, very malty and sugary sweet. Some subdued dark hops in there as well. Medium body, good carbonation.

Bottle from Timmy300. Of the three Russian Rivers that we had, this was my least favorite. Most peculiar, as I was expecting more of the malt and yeast character to really come through, but I feel like I got lambasted by the spicy, yet subdued hops. Some distinct breadiness was there, as well as spicy yeast character, though overall it came across as muted and uneventful. Nice, but nothing spectacular. Some age could do wonders on this one.
An old rating i finally got to entering. Aroma of yeast and brettiness with some hops to it. Flavor was actually pretty hoppy but still pretty belgian and light.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2008 [1229-20080328] 1pt9.4floz bottle. Citrus hoppy grass aroma with a hint of fresh shampoo. Slightly hazy, dark brown orange body with a medium-lasting bubbly white head. Grassy citrus pip flavour has a bitter finish. Medium-full body. Good. (7/3/7/3/15) 3.5
(Batch 002; c/o HogTownHarry, w/ him, blankboy, GregClow, jerc, tupalev)

[1387B-20080524] 750mL bottle. Lightly barrelly woody malt aroma with sweet grains. Clear, dark brown amber body with a quick creamy off-white head. Grainy malt flavour has a nice balance of malt and grain and toasted yeast. Medium body is grainy. Quite good. (7/4/8/3/16) 3.8
(Batch #002; c/o ?, w/ others)

Overheard: "Its 8 dollars a pint, 20 if you pull your own." -- referring to a porn stout...

UPDATED: SEP 18, 2009 750 ml bottle. Poured a mahogany color with a  thin head. The nose was soft to me and somewhat indistinct. I found this to be fairly well carbonated. There was some spices up front, and a yeasty malty backbone.Dry finish. Was more of a saison to  me than anything else, which isnt my favorite style.A good beer, but  not at  the top of the russian river list for me.

2nd rating
750 bottle. Batch 003. Poured a deeper mahogany color. Nose was much more distinguished this time the malt and yeast were very pronounced. The spices mellowed a bit and was more of a brown ale.  The Malta took over and were delicious. The finish was dry malty and rich. Much improved with aging.
